We have decided that in the best interest of the safety of our students and staff, we will start the school year in a virtual mode, with opportunities for small group, in-person learning for every student in the District. All curriculum will be developed and delivered by Fraser teachers.

We plan to continue in that mode through the first semester of school (January 22).

The Return to School Task Force considered a variety of options for the start of the year, but the more we studied how to safely bring students back to school, the more obstacles we uncovered. Our Task Force was concerned about the very likely possibility of starting and stopping in-person school repeatedly for quarantines. This would cause significant disruptions for students, staff and families. It would also make in-person learning less effective, less stable and certainly less safe than online learning.

Read the full letter to our families at: www.fraser.k12.mi.us/return

We are excited to announce we be will be partnering with the City of Fraser to offer free meals this summer at McKinley Barrier Free Park! This is in addition to offering meals at Fraser High School and Twain Elementary School.

Breakfast and lunch will be bagged for pickup at the same time by a parent or guardian.

Meals are available for all children up to age 18, or up to age 26 if they are enrolled in an educational program for the mentally or physically disabled that is recognized by a State or local public educational agency.

There will be no meal service Friday, July 3.

Meals will be served weekdays through August 13.
